body: Changes look good. Question: Where does the version number in the sqlci banner come from? Will these changes effect that one also?

Just making sure I understand the fix. It looks like the old code looked around for a node running Cloudera Manager, then ran a bunch of things on that node. The new code just runs things on the local node. So, I take it that the tacit assumption in the old code was that HDFS would be running on any node where Cloudera Manager was running but that assumption turns out not to be true? The new tacit assumption is that HDFS is running on the local node. Why is this a better assumption? 

Given that the new assumption is good, the code changes look great.
Code changes look good to me.
@DaveBirdsall - I believe the sqlci banner version comes from the setting in sqenvcom.sh.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/81/

Great questions.
So, I take it that the tacit assumption in the old code was that HDFS would
be running on any node where Cloudera Manager was running but that
assumption turns out not to be true? That is correct. In all our previous
testing I thought they would always be together. That is not the case at
all. Actually, from further study they are almost never together that is
not the recommended configuration.

The new tacit assumption is that HDFS is running on the local node. Why is
this a better assumption? Trafodion must be installed on nodes with HBase
and HBase needs HDFS. Trafodion does a check (not in this file... earlier
in install) that makes sure every node being installed on has HBase (so by
proxy HDFS).

An improvement in the future will be for the installer to be ran from
anywhere. Example: Hadoop Nodes n1 n2 n3 n4  Trafodion nodes n3 n4 and
install from n0 (a node not in cluster) n1-n4.

Apache Trafodion Conversational Interface 2.0.0
This is out of my area of expertise, but it looks good to me. Will commit it later today if there are no other comments.

This change is of no harm but helpful during troubleshooting as it displays not only DCS specific configuration but much more than that.  It would have been nice if this was displayed as a link on the main page  which would then show list the entire configuration on a new page rather than on the main page

Hegdean, Thanks for your comments. Ref to Apache Storm-UI Topology page. All-in-one instead of switching pages may be helpful here since you may get wanted info by CTRL+F on browser. It may support fold/unfold and something more will be added. But all the other things will be done in another pull-request. By the way, all configurations are from dcs-default.xml and dcs-site.xml. Don't worry, its style and backend might have significant changes in the next milestone.
The changes look good to me.
Given that the warning appears intermittently, will a known diff file or a filter to consume the warning (if produced) be a better solution? Thank you for taking care of this test failure.

Yes, once we fix the bug, we will regenerate the expected file.

Actually, it was determined that the fix has nothing with the appearance
and disappearance of the warning after one more around of the review of the
change, and the fact that update stats was not called during the test.

Looks good to me. Though the new Java utility module is beyond my expertise.
Looks good to me. I take it PR 158 needs to be merged before this one is?

Not sure I understand this change. When I look at "Files changed", I see just one change -- the addition of a blank line. Yet, when I click on each of the individual commits I see more. Which makes me wonder if this is being submitted against the right branch.
There was a conflict on this file and there were several other files from dcs/tests folder. Let me take a look
Please consider testing with HDP and apache hbase to ensure that this utility works with these distributions also
Just checking: Where are we on this change?

Sorry for delayed response reviewers.
I was looking into addressing Selva's comments but would like to defer them now
a) To set filesUser, filesGroup and filesMode on target cluster when FileUtil.copy is used, I could use the preserveAttributes method that is in Hbase' ExportSnapshot class. The method would have to be made more wide widely available than its current private visibility. I would like to look into how refactoring can be done better and also think of a way to test this change. Currently I don't have a cluster where hbase is installed under a different id.
b) Testing on apache and hdp will be good. I will try to add a small regression test to the backup script. Also need more time to get access to hdp and vanilla apache clusters.

I hope the change can be merged for now and I will address these two issue in my next delivery in this area.
Selva, are you good with that?
Not sure I understand this pull request. It appears to contain much of the same material in a previous pull request, PR 158?
Will netstat print ports in use from other users?
Revised changes look good to me also.

Yes, it is the same Dave. Sorry, I did not intend for the B/R commit to be included in this Pull Request. I used the same workspace, but a different branch. Apparently that is not enough. Let me find out what it will take to remove the B/R commit from here. It should not matter as it is the same change, but I would prefer to not commit it a second time.

Following Steve's advice I merged with master again and now the B/R commit is no longer visible in the PR. There is just a big merge commit. Thank you Steve.
PS Steve also indicated previous situation would have been harmless.
Looks good. Just wanted to check: Were the changes to runregr_executor.ksh intended? Or is that debug code?

Intended Dave. When I ran executor test015 I saw an error flash by on the screen where it was looking for the begin_odbc.ksh script and not finding it. I thought it will be good to not execute that line. There are a few other cqds and settings that are a leftover from old days. It will be a bigger task to clean them up too. Should have explained this in the commit message. Thanks for catching it.
Given that tests pass, I think this is ready to commit.
